review: The intermittent issues regarding the bluetooth wireless connection to the controller, as they often do not communicate unless they "feel like it", as well as the odd-ball controls on the app which enables the user to control with the phone, makes this almost unusable sometimes. If you are willing to put up with latency issues with the remote, as well as the odd interface which makes zero sense via the app, by all means buy this. My guess is you will be craving the Roku the moment you start using this. It has a lot of potential, but the firmware needs a serious upgrade to reach reliable performance which is not even a problem on Roku.
author: Larry M. Chaney

review: I just had received my fire stick a couple of days ago. I got very excited, but then disappointed, No matter what I try: Following instructions I could NOT get Netflix to work at all, I have seen many issues similar to this with other people. author: Karen

review: Happy with my purchase. Love the picture quality. I have a chromecast and three Roku boxes. Didn't think I would want a Fire TV stick. I got it free for signing up for 3 months of Sling TV. since I am a prime member and have been for years this was an awesome addition to my Gaget library. I have an iPhone 6. Not to many windows based apps play well with it. I was able to download an app that allows me to cast from my phone to the Fire Stick without an Apple TV, which I am not a fan of. Although I love my Roku boxes and don't plan to get rid of them I really think this Fire stick could go give Roku a run for the money. Overall I guess it's your preference. I happened to like this new channel line up I get with Fire in addition to all the content I have as a prime member
author: CocoBees_Teaches

review: As long as you have a decent router  this will be great.  Our old router was making the picture really choppy, once we got a new one the shows/movies are smooth.  My kids like to watch some of the shows from Disney and Nickelodeon on this.  Although it would be nice if Amazon prime would have a few newer movies available.  Also one of the things I didn't know when I bought it was that I have to plug it in to an outlet as well as the TV, not a big deal if you have enough outlets close to the TV...I do not so I need an extension cord.

review: I use this thing purely for my daughters Prime videos and occasional youtubing while folding clothes. UI is fast and responsive, setup was quick and easy, and streaming is smooth. In fact, it really beats out the Roku UI. But, content is king, and Roku still has more channels that I use regularly including Google Play.
